review_title: Excellent Adventure up there with Clash of the Titans and the 7th Voyage of Sinbad
review_detailed_main: I did not expect much from this movie but I was very surprised. I spent 2 hours in a story that I did not really want to be over. All performances were excellent and I see a bright future for the two young lovers. The movie never dragged even for a moment. The special effects were top notch and beautiful. The story line was logical and never is the movie viewer pondering why something is being done ( unless the movie viewer was not paying attention for some strange reason because I could not take my eyes off the screen ). My wife who is not usually a fan of fantasy movies loved this movie and wants to see it again. I strongly recommend this movie to all action movie fans and can say you will not be disappointed at all.

Movie is called "Gods of Egypt".

80% of the cast is white and British.

Pretty much all you need to know about the film.

A decent cast but that's about it. The acting was awful and dialogue even worse. Bek doesn't speak like he's ever had a conversation in his life, whether that's the actor's ability or the way he was written.

CGI at times wasn't good at all.

A barely watchable movie.

review_title: I would rather play the video game
review_detailed_main:
Alex Proyas went from the director of films of The Crow and Dark City to this. Gods of Egypt was an infamous flop with critics and audiences and deservingly so. It was a film that tried to copy 300 by being a special effects-heavy film based on ancient mythology.

In Gods of Egypt's case it was based on Egyptian mythology which was ripe material since it has been an untapped source for Hollywood. But this film ended up being a weird sci-fi/fantasy mashup that involved gods transforming into mechas and had Ra piloting a spaceship around a flat Earth.

Gods of Egypt was plotted like a video game where Horus and Osiris went from place to place to get an item or find an ally. The special effects looked more fitting for a PS3 game than a Hollywood film in 2016.

Proyas clearly wanted to make Gods of Egypt into a light-hearted adventure with Horus and Bek acting as a buddy duo, and having a lot of humour between the action set pieces. But when I watched the film I was thinking I would prefer to view Clash of the Titans or a similar film based on Greek mythology.

review_title: With a bit more effort it could have been decent
review_detailed_main:
As the opening scenes began, I could not help but sneer at the prospect of the calamity I assumed this film would be from what the trailer left to interpretation. And indeed with the musical score, I could not help but wonder if Gods of Egypt was meant to be an epic disaster of biblical proportions meant to amuse the greats of cinema in the afterlife...

But at the end of it, I could not help pondering if this could have not been done better with a bit more effort. No, not money - enough was thrown at it - probably a lot to have Gerald Butler to do his usual business of grunting and flexing his biceps and swinging some weapon, no doubt; certainly a substantial part of the budget must have gone to Victoria's Secret to scantily, but tastefully, clad the goddesses on the screen and of course the most impressive chunk (and here we can see a job well done) on the beautification and the glitz that at the end of the movie is meant to seductively lure us under the impression that it was worth spending our budget on the movie ticket rather than on a bigger flower bouquet for mum. Certainly, a humble amount of the film's budget must have been handed over to a poor conservatory student, probably in a back alley transaction, who at the last minute presumably copy-pasted together music from proper epics. Honestly, the score was so severely mismatched at times with the events going on, one had to be left wondering if this film was not meant as a parody. And no expense must have been spared for the poor script.

Alas, the only impressive element of the film remain its visuals. Every single scene, the viewers can expect to feast their eyes on the glittering images of a mythical Egypt, they can maybe feel themselves transposed to those beautifully rendered astral plains and to the vast bleakness of the underworld. The visuals helped convey the mood of a place or of a scene far better than the clearly placid effort of all the eye candy on set. Not meant to be disrespectful, but either for lack of better judgment, or sheer laziness, none of the actors seemed to do more than recite their lines as if in a school play written by the 2nd graders. Maybe they were hoping the CGI would mask their shortcomings? No, the greatest problem was not the acting - nobody would expect Shakespeare to pour into our ear from such a film, but the dialogue was simply atrociously puerile - hence my comparison to a school play. There were clear attempts at humor and grandeur alike - none of which can impress the adult audience Gods of Egypt was meant for. I mean, a few more polysyllabic words could not have hurt.

It was somewhat captivating, but this was not owed to good storytelling, as much as to seductive visuals. With a proper script, I am certain it would not have been slashed by critics. Had it been made into an animation and intended for a young audience, the producers could have even gotten away with the dialogue and the dull tale. The premise of the film was intriguing enough and there was obviously some didactic purpose to it, but there was not much to go on and the execution was lacking in several aspects. As an animation, it might have even been good and very welcome. But since this is not the case, this film has succeeded only in following along the line of numerous other blockbusters which give the critics pen fodder, which entertain us and remove us for their two hours from our dreary existence and once the experience is over, it's time to move on with business as usual. Gods of Egypt will leave no durable impression on viewers or on cinema in general and it will be forgotten along with all films of its kind.

All in all, it took itself too seriously when it was supposed to laugh at itself and was too self- deprecating when it should have been serious. Not recommended for cinephiles, for those looking for depth in films or simply for fans of good acting. But if you enjoy escapism or just take a kick out of seeing Gerard Butler grunt and flex, go ahead, you will not be (that) sorry. Oh, and there was a love story in there somewhere... it probably meant to be a star-crossed lovers type of deal, but it was just as uninspired as the rest.

Have a nice viewing!

I am giving 2 points, because there was some good tits and ass by girls, whom was actors in this film.

OK, let it be 3 because of Jamie Lannister.

This film is a shame. Bad story, bad actors, everything is bad, I can not say much more. Maybe if you smoke a really really big joint, it could be enjoyable, but I don't think so.

If you really want to know, who is Horus, let's see Immortels, that will show you that.

Or watch a document from National Geography.

Trust me, if you love adventure films, this is not for you.

review_title: Another predictable and protracted story where visual effects steal the show
review_detailed_main:
With the development and spread of digital technology, many filmmakers have wanted to fulfill their past dreams of creating something visually powerful and with smooth inclusion, with a wow! effect for viewers in front of big screens. Thus, no more drawings within feature films or aliens resembling vessels of war, but fairy-tales, myths and sci-fi unfolding in a compact and truthful manner.

Alas, this has often involved vain scripts, focusing on battles and motions, and over-the-shaft scenes for the sake of length and visualization. Besides, the cast is uneven, many characters come close to the ones seen before in other movies; even talented non-US character actors like Geoffrey Rush or Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau are unable to fill the vacuity, the rest are nothing special - or too much "hidden" behind flashing environment and covering costumes. Lots of scenes are too long or provide no additional value, repeating obvious issues again and again.

If it was the 1st movie of a kind, I would probably have rated it higher, but in 2016, it is just a copycat of dozens of myth-based movies of this millennium. Not a total flop, but no more than a mediocre work for those fond of "nice" stories where evil is defeated by good.

review_title: A mortal teams up with a God, to save Egypt
If you like this kind of thing - OK.
review_detailed_main: We don't really get enough adventures in movie form, I mean the Clash of the Titans I remember when young (the remake -er - nah). I love a good adventure movie and fantasy to boot. Here we had a slightly promising cast promising lush CGI and action. It was a fine enough mindless diversion with most attempts at humour falling flat, a few hitting. Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau channeling his Game of Thrones Jamie character to a minor extent is hard not to approve of. Butler gives a normal day at the office enthusiasm with his Character, he's alright. Rufus Sewell, underused is a silly role. Chadwick (the new Black Panther) given little time for a curious character. Anyway the whole movie was curious and the extensive CGI used simply detracted from the movie. Some of it looked simply bad and not 2016 and equivalent to its budget. Came across as a mediocre 3 year old video game you could only watch. Had me actually pining for Immortals which is I think the movie of this style I've enjoyed most in the past few years.
I kept wondering to myself - why won't this end? I gave it 2-stars because of the young character and his action sequences.

review_title: Exciting Roller Coaster Ride, don't go with the ratings its an amazing movie
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie with a lot of reservations - Europeans and American Actors portraying Egyptian God & Goddess? The mediocre CGI transformations. However the setting of the movie is beautiful and visually impressive. The story is very straight forward Good Vs Evil which is throwback to years when movie plots were less complicated. The movie held my undivided attention throughout the run time and the acting was surprisingly well done. All in all I absolutely love this movie. The movie won't get an Oscar for this but for a fun filled evening this is a perfect choice. Watch it and give your own rating, don't listen to cynical movie critics.

review_title: The movie was all over the place & really the only reason to watch this is because the special effects are pretty impressive
review_detailed_main: "Your journey has just begun." The God Horus (Coster-Waldau) Is just about to be crowned king of Egypt. Right before the crown is placed on his head his brother Set (Butler) attacks him and robs him of his powers. With Set in charge Egypt begins to crumble. When a mortal seeks to restore order there is only one person he can turn to, Horus. Now the two, God and man, must find a way to defeat Set and restore order to the once peaceful land. I have to begin by saying that I am not a huge fan of these types of movies. Never been that big into mythology and the epic BC movies have never really interested me all that much. I'm not sure if that had something to do with this or not but I didn't enjoy this movie at all. The dialog is awful, the story is confusing; mainly because it couldn't decide what it wanted to be. Part of it was mythology, part of it was sci- fi, in one scene Horus gets his eye back...then flies into outer space. The movie was all over the place and really the only reason to watch this is because it looks great and the special effects are pretty impressive, on the other hand if the movie is bad none of that matters. Overall, a movie I wasn't excited to see and turned out worse that I was expecting. I give this a C-.

After 4 years, I've gained much courage to see this film and after watching I realized I should skip it for good. There's nothing interesting except the transitions of Gods. The story was purely non-sense and it just flew over my head... CGI was also poor on some shots. Totally a waste of time....

Ok I can handle the stereotype acting for rhis kins of movies, even when it is not that good. But when the script crumbles like a cookie in hot water and it simply looks bad to see people who are looknas egyprian as I do with my blue eyes, than it starts to hurt. Ow yea sfx are great, i hear people aaying, but no, they are not. The enlarging effects (giant gods vs mortal human beings) went all wrong during a swam acene. The tiny human had the water coming up tonhis calves, while the giant goddeaa had the water coming uo to knee level...in the same shot. So no. Not my kind of movie.

It's a real shame that such a rich vein of exciting mythology has been reduced to this really badly acted and written celebration of the art of the computer programmers. That's not to say that their creative and technical skills are not appreciable. Indeed, this is a great looking film with some engaging visual effects and quite a decent score, too - but even the cute smile of Brenton Thwaites, the occasional contribution from Geoffrey Rush (with his tongue will implanted into his cheek) and something akin to the cerebral from Chadwick Boseman cannot turn this slowly paced effort that is as derivative of "The Mummy" (without any attempt at humour) as it is of "Clash of the Titans" (without the monsters) into anything substantial. I suppose to have acted amongst a series of almost entirely green screen scenarios must have been quite difficult - but sadly, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau is simply not up to the task, and Gerard Butler - well, what does he think he is doing in this drivel? This could have been so very much better, if someone had taken the time to develop these ancient characters and present us with a storyline that challenged our imagination. As it is, it's little better than a glorified cartoon that I suggest needs to be forgotten.

review_title: Best action movie seen so far
review_detailed_main:
I enjoyed this over the top extravagant adventure set in Ancient Egypt. The script cleverly uses the legends of the Egyptian gods. It's fun to see the god brought to life and transform into various birds and beasts. Now everyone can visualize the gods instead of imagining them from a 2 dimensional painting on a wall. The tale of Horus avenging the murder of his father Osiris by fighting Set is brought to life.

The visuals are spectacular dizzying and fantastical. You get some pretty impressive cities temples caves tombs pyramids and the underworld.

This movie was so far the best action this year. I don't know why people are hating. This movie was fun, entertaining, funny, loved the action scenes. Loved how the movie was viewed just like the stories we all loved in school. You won't be disappointed. Got to see this movie at a prescreening. Loved it. Would watch again.

review_title: Class C movie with known actors
review_detailed_main: Why in heaven is people giving 10/10 to this? Omg the CGI is constant and terrible, the plot doesn't feel right and the performance is... Well, you get my point.
Is was entertaining, whach it it with the right mindset and have fun, that's it!!! nothing else!!!

review_title: Far too "Jason and the Argonauts" for my liking
review_detailed_main: Far too much reliance on ridiculously unbelievable special effects and a weak storyline. Add to that ridiculously loud music, where you keep having to turn up the volume to hear the dialogue, only to have to turn it down when the music kicks in. Why on earth do film makers do that? Do they thinks that we're all deaf, or have no neighbours?

review_title: The plot is too straight and naive. Nothing but love's clothes and eyes.
review_detailed_main: The plot is too straight and naive. Nothing but love's clothes and eyes.

review_title: What is there not to like!!
review_detailed_main:
After reading the reviews I was quite skeptical spending money and wasting some valuable time to go watch in the theaters instead of waiting for it to come on DVD yet a friend insisted we give it a go despite the critics negative reviews and boy I was entertained!! A solid spectacular adventure roller coaster from start to finish set in an extremely stylish ancient Egyptian atmosphere with a great cast is what we got!! I really don't get the cynics any more they seem to expect an Oscar winner even in the fun adventure Genre!! Was Indiana Jones ever going to win an Oscar?!! I expect these movies to be reviewed fairly in comparison with others in the same genre and in that regards this movie scores a straight 9/10 for a solid engaging story telling well acted and directed with excellent visual effects and some great costumes that glorifies this period and does justice!! Personally I am an avid move watcher and take great pride in my movie opinion and analysis and this one is certainly a must watch adventure movie if you ask my humble opinion and one of the very best adventure movies ever made about ancient Egypt it is surely miles better than the Mummy series!!

The movie does a great job bringing the fantasy to life in style and sequence of events that surely will captivate the audience attention throughout. My honest opinion and advise don't listen to critics on this one actually don't listen to them when it comes to these type of movies period as they seem to have a thing or two against them for some strange reason and for that they seem to turn a blind eye towards all the glamour, style and story telling. Go watch it folks and see for yourselves one of the best blockbusters in the last couple of years an extremely amazing and memorable saga that surely will watch it over many times to come.

Much like how Clash of the Titans (2010) and Immortals mined Greek mythology to respectable commercial success, Gods of Egypt is an attempt to mine what "blockbuster potential" there is to be had from Egyptian mythology. Based in a world where Gods are 12 Feet tall, live among humans, and bleed gold, the film follows Mortal thief Bek and exiled God Prince Horus in their journey to take down usurper Set for differing reasons. The movie does look nice as there's tons of detail with fantastical structures and vivid colors, but then the novelty wears off when everything else fails to engage. Bek and Horus aren't compelling protagonists and the only fun to be had comes from Gerard Butler as Set giving a reasonably entertaining hammy villain performance. The spectacle is beautiful, but if there's nothing engaging you it has about the same entertainment value as a theme park ride, except theme park rides at least have the decency not to be two hours long. If you need your ancient Egyptian trash blockbuster fix, stick with Brendan Fraser's first two Mummy movies or Roland Emmerich's Stargate.

This looks like one of those old Cecille B. DeMille biblical epics of the 1960s with much better special effects, due to modern CGI techniques. Instead of Old Testament rivals, we get Horus and Get battling for the soul of Egypt. Get is a god of darkness and Horus is the good guy; or god of light. The opening features a fight between the two, which results in the bad guy plucking out the good guys eyeballs. The obligatory mortal hero comes along to assist Horus in regaining Egypt while also attempting to reunite with his one true love. The only recognizable actor is Gerard Butler as Get; in a similar role he did in "300." The script is rather silly but the CGI is spectacular. Gods of Egypt needs to be seen on a big screen. I do not know why the budget was $140 million, as this is, at best, a 4/10.

This movie was really bad. I mean this movie is bad in a entertaining way, but that doesn't hide all the problems with it.

The acting is over the top, especially with the performance of Gerard Butler as the main villain. I like Gerard Butler as an actor, but he gave a laughable performance in this film.

The use of CGI is everywhere in this movie. In locations, fights, armor/weapons, and the creatures they have. It's mostly distracting in how clearly fake it looks.

At times you can tell that there's a green screen behind them, which is distracting along with the bad CGI effects and the bad acting.

In the fight scenes they cut a lot and it can be hard to see, but mostly they use CG for the action scenes if its something over the top.

The 3rd act climax is fully bloated and crazy, but it doesn't help how it becomes another cliche final battle. The battle is laughable but you can be entertained.

I think you will have a good laugh at the dialogue, characters, and use of CGI in this movie. It is bad, but I can see people being entertained and maybe having some fun with it.

review_title: Not the worst, but far from good
review_detailed_main:
So, this movie's mistake is forcing the story into the Eqyptian mythology or vice-versa. Maybe I don't understand Egyptian mythology well enough to appreciate all the references, but I couldn't make heads or tails of the worldbuilding. I think the humor and technology are egregiously excessive and therefore misplaced. I also think they didn't do any favors to the mythology by trying to provide the humor they did. It kept the story from being taken seriously. Where are the limits to gods' immortality, invulnerability, and power? Where are the real consequences? Very predictable.

This is going to sound contradictory, but if the story is simply set in a fictional / original (albeit completely analogous) fantasy world, it would work much better. There are many clever ideas and visuals. Traps, monsters, riddles, magic... Think more like D&D, Prince of Persia, etc, and this can work.

Also, Bek is too OP for a mortal for my liking, unlike...say Perseus in Clash of the Titans, who, was helped by the gods with magical weapons and armor. He is also written with a tremendous amount of hubris and cockiness which appears to go on with little consequence.

I believe Set is unfortunately a boring, one-dimensional villain when I think he could be much more interesting.

Individually, I think the actors were good. There was some good dialogue moments, but the basic storyline is mostly cliche.

Sorry if my review is a bit disorganized, but it's a late-night review. I will leave it there.

"Gods of Egypt" expresses an intense effort in its cinematography, but is accompanied by disappointing characters that are all brawn and no brain or heart. The characters are forgettable and lack substance, and the dialogue is comically bad.

I have no idea what's with the low rating on this movie. I loved it from the very start, to the very end. I think the story was very good, the characters were developed pretty well, the dialogue's were meaningful and yet humorous. Plenty of beautiful places and adventures. I really hope there will be a sequel for this one. As for the ''whitewash'' as some people call it, it is only natural. History, is not exactly the way is taught in school. The flat earth part in the movie, is indeed very accurate and true. Also the ''Gods'' or aliens at the time, might have been white. Either way, there were multiple races in that period, and this movie portrays them very well. The battles and costumes are not exaggerated, many legends speak of several battles between alien races, their outfit and armament fit the description as well. Overall, the story is beautiful, filled with many trials, adventures and even love. I do recommend this movie to be watched with an open mind, as well as with an open heart. I was certainly not disappointed.

review_title: Big budget, but big waste of your time
review_detailed_main: Just saw this on Netflix... what a monstrosity... CG wasn't terrible, but the live action compositing WITH that CG was god awful. Granted there were some very ambitious shots, but those involved clearly didn't know how to direct, shoot and post-produce an effects film. Had some deep pockets for the EXCESS CG work though.. Story was about as deep as an 80s adventure video game, and with very average acting, probably due to being entirely green screen, and with all the nonsense human/god height differences.

review_title: When the technology is more important than the story
review_detailed_main: There is so much inspiration we can get from ancient Egypt, or Greek mythology. Taken it is a fantasy movie, the story is rather poor and the actors not performing at their best. Costumes are good (surely better than THOR!), but the characters clearly not having an Egyptian look. Lots of money for not much. The 10 Commandments is still the best in the topic, and was produced half a century ago!
Good story but bad animation. The story is true to the egypt myths.

review_title: I like the movie so Much

review_detailed_main: Cheep production value, the special effects look like something from the 1990's, not 2016. The acting was not great and the story was spotty.

review_title: Movie for teenagers with lots of center screen cleavage.
review_detailed_main:
Was obviously a pretty large production and the effects quality was good but, it is not a movie for someone over twenty years old unless they are actually into silly action fantasy films. I did find the accents off putting since it was supposed to be in Egypt.

The acting was fine, plot was easy to follow, cinematography was fine and casting was good.

I think it is quite silly people review this as anything but a fun, ridiculous, movie. It was better than watching commercial TV and that's about it. I don't really know what the inspiration for this movie was and I don't care to actually. I did read another review complaining about inadequate ethnic diversity but that is a crazy statement. There was a melting pot of actors and why does that even matter? Someone needs to get a grip! It's a MOVIE...

Not TOO bad, but the CGI is a letdown. It's obvious and not convincing at all, especially the scenes where the GODS are shown in proportion to mortal man. There doesn't appear to be any consistency whatsoever. Could have been so much better.

There's a sketch of a good story here, with all the parts that work.

Many of the actors are really trying, and some of the characters are great. But some are awful, and stupid (the hero kid is a typical nobody who cannot act his way out of a paper bag, and it drags down everything). Every effect shot looks like it's a 10 year old made-for-TV movie. And every shot is an FX shot. Every set seems to be mostly digital.

And if that's not enough, they just lost the thread. It's a mess. So oddly edited together, so much focus on the action which are such bad FX they don't really feel perilous or as cool as they could be.

Too bad. Really thought it might be going somewhere for a bit, but it just got stupid and sad so fast.

Saw GODS OF Egypt and have no idea what movie the critics saw. They are savagely mauling this movie but it is better than both of the recent Clash of the Titans movies combined. They have forgotten what it is like to have fun at the movies. There is utterly astonishing world building here. Rich elegant costumes and set designs that remind me of Liz Taylor's Cleopatra. Breathtaking stunts. The unknown cast contains Marvel's Black Panther Chadwick Boseman and Daredevil's Elektra Elodie Young. Both of these two rising stars give great performances and each of their roles seems to be a preview of what they will bring the MCU. The script is flawed but the style and lavish design overcomes the basic redemption movie storyline. It's lots of fun. (3.5 out of 5) So Says the Soothsayer

review_title: It lacks everything, but the CGI
review_detailed_main:
Stunning CGI.

Well, that is it. The rest, however, is utter crap. The older actor's rolls and performances are horrendous and the younger actor's rolls and performances are silly, shallow and would probably do better in a music video or on Youtube.

But the CGI is fantastic and constant. What a waste.

This movie lacks some dirt and grit. It lacks everything, but the CGI. What it does not lack is people running around believing they are in a Katy Perry music video.

It has glitter and it has gold, when it should have had grit and dirt.
Poor Cinematic. Actors have poor acting (except for Gerard Butler). Story is dull.

This movie could have been great! Unexplored mythology in the cinema with so much to go from there...

But what came out was a movie with a hollow storyline and crappy CGI. It is a movie to watch in a hangover day, when you wish to think of nothing and just lay on the couch as a useless human being

I don't know what frustrates me more. How this movie is terrible or how the crew making it just kept arguing over story problems and slammed everything together to ultimately make it terrible.

Gods of Egypt is one of the worst fantasy movies ever made and a complete waste of time for everyone making it. It unfortunately is brought down by terrible writing that delivers a boring and unengaging story, ugly-looking visuals that often seem unfinished, poorly-crafted action scenes, a cast of boring and generic characters, unexpectedly offensive stereotypes, and TERRIBLE acting from celebrities involved where it's easily noticeable that they JUST DIDN'T CARE about this movie.

In the case of the recommendation, just don't bother. This is one of the best examples there is of a movie that's not worth your time. I wouldn't recommend this to action junkies, since they'll be both bored and disgusted. Well, let's just hope we don't get any more crap like this anytime soon.

review_title: Great Action/Thriller/Sc-Fi with excellent Special Effects, Story and Acting
review_detailed_main:
I am unsure why this movie has an under 6 IMDb score. I guess people thought this movie to be something it was not. This movie is in the same theme as Clash of Titans or many other Greek God themed action/ Sc-Fi movies. This however is based on the Egyptian Gods and is packed full of thrills, action with great special effects. The cast has some very big banes in it and as much as all the cast played their roles exceptional the main characters are a stand out with people like Ge3offery Rush, Brenton Thwaites, Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau, Elodie Yung and Gerard Butler to name just a few.

This is a classic good Vs evil scenario with the Gods of Egypt under siege by the evil Set, but without the help of the mortals, then only can Egypt be taken out of the throes of the evil God Set.

The screen jumps with magic, it is a movie with no slow parts, no gaps where you are not visually entertained. I think this movie is so go that if the writers, actors, directors etc where to do a prequel or a sequel, it would be also worth watching. This movie is worth watching if you like Sc-Fi. I don't know if every ancient God and Egypt that are portrayed are historically correct but it is not meant to be a documentary but a thrilling and exciting good Vs evil movie that packs a punch visually and with the actor's presence, Fantastic.

When i watched this movie.poor CGI and simple story bothered me. almost i could predict the whole of the story.and casting was poor except antagonist(Gerard Butler).i could not understand and connect with Brenton Thwaites as one of the heroes.. this movie had potential to be one of the admirable movies .but it was waste of money and time.in addition weak story could not make any sense for me.

This is a movie of ancient gods, their flaws, greed and motives.

A story for the ages where Egyptian gods, flawed by their humane desires, walk side by side with native mortals. A true Cinderella story where all is normal, then turned into chaos, climaxing with dreadful end of the world type happenings summoning unlikely heroes and ending in a rather ceremonious great resurrection of life and peace. Even with all of the supernatural beings and gods ruling over humans, or mortals as this film says, the story remained within the humane lines of moral dilemmas and relations between admiration and resent, love and hate, greed and generosity and trusting or doubting others. Really, this motion picture is a visually beautiful, often quite remarkable, piece of cinema, sadly, eternally ruined by poorly edited and rushed content. This potential diamond was honestly neglected enough so that it was reprocessed into mere coal. This was noticeable from pretty much the first scenes already. The actors dialogues felt very forced up to the point where I could imagine the director, Alex Proyas, shouting for actors to be quicker and less savoring with their lines. The scenes were too hastily run through and as this progressed throughout the film, the quality of a golden story was turned into a, at most, B-class film. I expected more and thought it could've been a bit slower with the progression of things, instead of rushing into events and lines like some kind of a speed trial. If I could I would choose not to watch it, just to save the thought of a great, action filled, story with gods and mortals. I'm sorry for the actors and the teams behind this movie. For they most certainly did not deserve this kind of a result.

review_title: Well, I guess I'm a diseased vulture then...
review_detailed_main:
There are films that are so bad they're good and then there are films that are so bad they're just bad. Gods of Egypt very much falls into the latter because it really is just an awful film. Weirdly, I'd been anticipating this film for a while and it's finally arrived in the UK, a whole four months after its release across the pond.

Although I'd heard nothing but bad things about Gods of Egypt, I was always keen to see for myself whether it was actually that bad. Alex Proyas, the director of this film, came out in defence of his work and described modern day critics as 'diseased vultures pecking at the bones of a dying carcass' back when the film was originally slated by critics who got to see this total mess four months ago.

Here I would normally give a brief rundown of the plot however, due to the scattershot nature of this film's plot, I will try my best to keep it as brief as possible.

Betrayed and exiled by his uncle Set (Gerard Butler), Horus (Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau) is a god who was to be crowned the new King of Egypt. Under Set's reign, Egypt descends into chaos and human Bek (Brenton Thwaites) takes it upon himself to find Horus and persuade him to return and defeat Set to regain his rightful place as the King of Egypt.

I can't stress enough just how embarrassing every aspect of this film is. For starters, there is not one actor who gives anything resembling a good performance, whether it be Gerard Butler as Set or Geoffrey Rush, yes Geoffrey Rush, as Ra. I've never really been majorly impressed with Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau in Game of Thrones and he does nothing that could possibly change my mind in Gods of Egypt.

Elodie Young is in the same boat in the way that she never impressed me too much in Daredevil and she's not very good here either. The worst of the bunch though has got to be Brenton Thwaites as Bek, who has more or less the same delivery for every emotion; utterly emotionless.

Then comes the writing...

Matt Sazama and Burk Sharpless are a writing duo who haven't written a well received film yet in their three attempts. This is the only film of theirs I've seen and if this is anything to go by, I will be avoiding Dracula Untold and The Last Witch Hunter. The dialogue is so laughably bad throughout the entire film and the story jumps from scene to scene with no cohesion whatsoever. I don't think I've seen a film where I've laughed at nearly every single line before.

Alex Proyas, judging from his comments about critics, is not a man who can take any criticism lightly. I would be able to describe Proyas as a style over substance director if the visuals were any good but they just aren't. For a film with a $140 million budget, you'd think they'd at least be able to make it look good. It makes me wonder whether they just blew all of the budget on the cast. Gods of Egypt feels like you're watching someone play a shoddy video game rather erratically, particularly during the fight scenes where Peter Menzies Jr.'s cinematography will leave you dizzy and wanting the sick bucket.

Are there any positives I can take from Gods of Egypt? Marco Beltrami's score was probably the best thing about this film and oh, the film did finish eventually which was a bonus. I felt exhausted as I left the cinema because the film is far too long at just over two hours, it becomes a chore to watch, especially when going in to the cinema thinking it was going to be just an hour and a half long.

As of now, Gods of Egypt has surprisingly made a profit on its budget. Not a profit the studio would be hoping for though, coming in at a measly $2 million. Sounds stupid to say that's a measly amount however, in today's market, that's an amount that could well see careers end.
Kitschy and uninspired, this big-budget movie gets bogged down in sets that are a mix of cardboard and flimsy CGIs, and doesn't bring honor to the Egyptian mythology.

Before watching this movie, I thought according to ratings and reviews that I saw this will be some kind of boring soap opera, or shallow action movie in style of Michael Bay ! Thank God, I am not a sheep, meaning I do take into consideration reviews from some critics, IMDb and Rotten T., but still I do take my own decision always regarding movies or TV Series I am about to watch, or I watched. That means that I consider my own rating as alpha and omega. After all it is my personal taste and not of some critic or casual viewer. Enough of philosophy, this movie attracted me no matter low reviews and ratings. So I started to watch and instantly magic happened. I was simply drawn into this world of ancient magic of gods and mortals and right from first minute of movie I was totally immersed into this masterpiece (my humble opinion). I watched movie online so I well used advantage of being able to watch scenes again and again ! This is no soap opera, everything what happens is both ordinary and very deep (depend on how subtle is your perception), action is nothing shallow but merged with strong emotions, powerful energy, very good fighting skills and good effects. Yes effects are really good in this movie and it simply got hold of your attention as everything look so real and authentic that you feel being part of it. Story is very good and not even one second boring, there is no wasting of time here, each and every second of movie is used 100% and truly there is no dull moment, absolutely no soap opera-things are very serious here, no shallow emotions life and death are constantly present like shadow and light, darkness and sun. Yes we even get chance to see personal boat and fighting skills of Sun God Ra Himself ! And that part as all other parts of movie are, is simply magnificent ! I don't know whether I will fire up someone attention to see this movie and hopefully watch it with open mind and not damaged by bad reviews and ratings,thus allow himself to fully experience beauty and greatness of this movie. I am very glad that I did, and I have to tell you that now several days already I am watching again and again scenes from this movie and feel powerful emotions and awe again and again. Allow yourself to watch this movie and forget ratings, if you do it and watch it with your 100% attention I guarantee to you that you will enjoy at least some parts of this movie very much even if is not movie merged with your personal taste. You will still enjoy some parts cause movie is truly well made from beginning till end. PS What is really amazing is that I really wanted to know which animal did represent Seth's main god warrior. I thought it was bull, but after watching one fighting scene he was involved I realized that he was goat ! Quite huge goat but still goat :-) Sorry for my grammar mistakes, I am obviously not UK or USA native, but still - I tried ;-)

22 June 2016 Film of Choice at The Plaza Dorchester Tonight. - Gods of Egypt. What an awesome film. This is one of the good ones. It's a story of Gods fighting Gods, the role of mortals in the grand scheme of the Lands of Egypt and ultimately a love story. The screenplay is gargantuan in its delivery, the soundtrack is almost overwhelming, This is the tale of a family of Gods, Set (Gerard Butler) kills his brother and steals the eyes of Horus forcing him to live in the desert sightless and without power. Set plans to become King and rule the lands with misplaced power and fear. However we are introduced to Bek, a mortal who does not take no for an answer and will go to the ends of this world and into the next to save the girl he loves. In the days before CGI this film would still be awesome, right up there with Ben Hur, Spartacus and all those other biblical epics told over the years with a cast of thousands and stars aplenty. However we can now go further, bigger, badder, louder, and much more grand and the cast of thousands is created with a screen and a mouse. It does not lessen the impact of this film in any way and I enjoyed the delivery from start to finish. It gives the viewer a glimpse into the opulence of ancient Egypt and the costume designer must have been given a complete free rein with absolutely stunning results. A feast for the eyes and the ears. If you like an adventure you'll love this film.

I didn't realise this movie had so many Australians in it! The first 5 minutes I thought OMG this is not going to meet my expectations. I was wrong. I loved it. Totally enjoyable. Lots of action. Great lines. Laughed heaps. Thought Bek was great. Highly entertaining. I wanted to stop here, but I need to write 10 lines of review. The CGI was great. The action scenes were full on. Time passed quickly, so the editing was spot on. Go and see it, especially if you are Australian! Support our film industry. Surely I have written 10 lines now :0) No! Set the villain did fantastic job. Go and see it. Go and see it. Go and see it. :0)

review_title: A surprisingly good time at the movies.... just don't expect Shawshank Redemption-quality filmmaking
review_detailed_main: I wasn't too fond of the commercials or the trailer for Gods Of Egypt, I just thought it looked like a B-movie from Netflix. I was bored and decided to give this a chance, even with all the negative reviews on Rotten Tomatoes. I actually had a pretty good time with this movie, despite the lack of appreciation from the other filmgoers in the theater. All of the action scenes will satisfy the 11 year-old audience because of the ridiculousness, and the adults will be instantly entertained. As for the CGI, it's not too bad actually, most of it looks really cool, but the green-screen is used way too much, which is my one downside that I had while watching it. The Sun God and the villain stole the show for me, they were just too awesome in those epic action sequences. Before you watch this movie, which you should, it's a really good time, see the 3D version, this is the only movie released so far this year that uses it correctly, and it helps the action look slicker and shinier and makes the green-screen look better and make the actors standing in front of it pop out more fluidly. Don't listen to the harsh people- just watch it and enjoy the fresh, crisp action and observe the cool visuals(like I said, see the 3D screening, it adds something to the superb special effects).

This is way better than those boring cookie cutters comic series from Marvel. How did Antman earn 7.4 rating and pg13 ? That movie is so trashy full of obscene words it deserves an X. Let audience be warned.

Story line is refreshing. Good originality. Good visual. Good sound. Reviewers compared this to Clash of the Titans. This is a far better movie.

Maybe people just don't like Egypt. All the negativity associated with mid east turn people off. Thus the low rating. Can't believe all the negative syndicated reviews. Is it because this is from a small company. Not a power house like Marvell ?

review_title: a Remarkable Attempt at Original Vision
review_detailed_main:
Why this movie got panned, I don't know. I expect some sort of CGI- fantasy fatigue might have happened, as I expect happened with X-Men Apocalypse. That or hopefully not, a peer-related opinion defining phenomenon among critics (and their lesser bloggers). Oh well, great movies both; don't believe the hate.

Short opinion on Gods of Egypt; a wonderfully rich attempt at creating a fairy tale based on Egyptian legend, with fantastic dialogue (though some might, sarcastically, not be able to let it sink in), strong characters, interesting plot and fulfilled story line. Technically it is not flawless, but pretty close.

Rid yourself of your sarcasmosuit, and you will enjoy this sweet, sweet piece of blockbuster awesomeness.

Proyas; you're okay in my book!

review_title: Lavish Visual Effects Salvage this Film
review_detailed_main:
The Alex Proyas fantasy film 'Gods of Egypt', which for the first time in a while vilifies the Award-winning actor Gerard Butler as the Egyptian god of War, Set, also elevates seasoned actor Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau (you may recognize him for his role as Jaime Lannister in Game of Thrones).

Set in the mythological world of a bountiful Egypt, a place christened as 'heaven on Earth' where the gods have decided to settle among the human race and rule over it, Osiris is handing over his crown and throne to his son Horus (played by Nikolaj), at a profligate ceremony that sees Egyptians from all over the realm come to pay homage and celebrate the millennium of peace they have graciously enjoyed under the incumbent.

The god of War, Set, who happens to be Osiris' brother, comes to spoil the party for his nephew however, as he forcefully takes over the reigns in what would soon prove to become a blood-thirsty selfish onslaught for power and dominance. We swiftly discover that while the gods may live far longer than humans, there is some mortality to their existence, as they bleed gold amidst their shape- shifting capabilities. Known as 'beast mode', Set and Horus transform in a cataclysmic duel that leaves Set victorious and Horus banished sightless.

The true champions of the epic fantasy however, amidst all the majesty of a surfeit of powerful beings, happen to be the couple Bek and Zaya (played by Brenton Thwaites and Courtney Eaton respectively). Their love, which literally knows no boundaries, pushes men and gods alike to jettison all fear and restraint, in a battle to save the realms of both beings from total chaos.

An unlikely pair of Horus (light) and Bek end up journeying through the fantastic world of Egypt, and the realm of the 'creator', the god Ra, as they seek to get back Horus' abilities, as well as his self-worth and belief, in order to mount up a challenge against the increasingly insurmountable Set, who usurps the powers of other gods in his quest for supremacy.

While the film may have, and continue to, receive a lot of flak for its lack of casting diversity, which pundits have declared is partly the source of its globally lackluster performance at the Box Office, one cannot take away from it the epic yet sternly successful proportions to which the producers and directors have gone to further the obsession with Egypt and its archaeological and mythological history to produce a stunning film.

'Gods of Egypt' may be laden with a weak script, but it will take you on a pleasurable journey into the majesty envisioned of Egyptian deities, breathtaking landscapes and a plunge into how high (Set's tower not withstanding) the stakes are in the age-old battle of light versus darkness.

review_title: "Gods of Egypt" is Above the February Movie Line! But Because of Casting Choices and Over-reliance on CGI, I Give it Stars of Nine.
review_detailed_main:
I discovered "Gods of Egypt" when it was suggested by "The Divergent Series: Allegiant" trailer. It's very attractive for a fantasy action adventure movie. A story in the ancient Egypt is very refreshing to me, especially featuring gods instead of mummies. February feels like a passive month for movies, where usually romance and drama films dominate. Thankfully, this awesome movie is released.

Set, the god of the desert, has taken over Egypt. Mortal hero Bek joins forces with Horus, god of the sky, to restore peace and order.

It's a visually stunning movie from start to finish. For a 140 million USD film, this is impressive. Fight scenes are well- choreographed. Music is great. Set pieces and props are intricately detailed. I like the scenes featuring the giant serpents, the goddess of love Hathor, the god of wisdom Thoth, the Sphinx, and the booby traps. There's also a memorable scene where the afterlife is featured, where the dead will offer gold heavier than the white feather to enter the next life. The movie also immerses you into the Egyptian environment.

However, I just don't like how the main cast is mostly white. Ancient Egypt is composed of Blacks and Arabs. I understand that the studios are betting on Gerard Butler for his "300" and "Olympus Has Fallen" movie successes. He's prominently shown in trailers and TV spots, even though he's a villain. Also, some scenes heavily rely on CGI instead of practical effects. The armors of the winged creatures, who are Set and Horus, feel like taken from a video game. A scene where Set is riding a chariot feels CG-dependent. I guess they should have used CG to be the icing and not the cake base.

On a lighter note, I appreciate Lionsgate and Alex Proyas's separate apologies for the casting choice. Probably Australia's rules for tax incentives and relying on well-known actors are primary factors. They're humble enough to admit their shortcomings. I love the film. I'm actually delighted that this comes out on Feb. 24, just three days after my birthday! It's a gift! If they include a racially diverse cast for a sequel, I'll see it with greater excitement.

5 years and now I am giving it a review. Watching this movie was an completely new experience for me I never through someone could make a movie like this. I understand that it may heart some people feeling as its title is controversial and the way of sowing it is also but still I enjoyed it very much. Don't trust on my review if you are reading this watch it yourself.

After all the bad reviews I was pleasantly blown away from beginning to end. Was action packed with no dull moments. I don't think this was ever met to be an accurate representation of Egyptian culture or an Oscar winner. Every fantasy/action movie is going to have holes in it. Dont overthink it! Just enjoy a fun, entertaining movie!

review_title: Can't get any better for a mythological movie.
review_detailed_main:
Finally something that could entertain me in 2016. I don't know what the critics are about. This movie was really good. A bit of a farce and some of the animation could have been better. However still an excellent movie.

These actors appeared to be 100% invested in making this film work, and they got the job done, in my opinion.

I'm extremely impressed to see this excellent movie based on ancient Egypt that is certainly for me this movie has done justice for the money invested.

Critics are again all over the fact that predominantly white actors are playing Egyptians, oh come on! We pay to get entertain and trust me i was totally impressed.

Nearly didn't watch this because of the (unwarranted) ratings. Forget the factual and glaring faux pa's, and settle down for a couple of hours of brilliant storytelling that is surprisingly enjoyable. For any fans of myths and legends, swords and sorcery and anything else in a similar genre, pull up a chair, relax and enjoy the fun. Well worth the time to watch

review_title: MY KIDS LOVE IT AND SO WILL YOURS!!! Magnificent (visually). MY KIDS LOVED IT MORE THAN "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" TO MY SURPRISE!!!
review_detailed_main: MY KIDS LOVE IT AND SO WILL YOURS!!! Magnificent (visually)!!! Why, because it's truly better than "Clash of the Titans" through the kids eyes!!! Gosh, adults are so spoiled today!!! Remember the kind of movies you used to see when you were a KID??? I wished there were movies like this in my childhood that are so visually stunning, plus thrilling with all those amazing unique characters!!! Didn't you loathe watching the same old movies on TV or in the theater as a kid and you had no choice? I grew up watching over and over, every single year, movies like "The Thief of Bagdad", "Clash of the Titans", "Sinbad of the Seven Seas", "Moses", "Spartacus", and various versions of Gladiator movies, too. I LOVE TO TAKE MY KIDS TO THE MOVIES ALL THE TIME, AND THEY HAVE SEEN LOTS OF SUMMER MOVIES EVERY SINGLE YEAR. SHOCKING TO ME AS A MOTHER, THAT MY 16 YEARS OLD, 12 YEARS OLD, AND 9 YEARS OLD SONS CLAPPED LOUDLY AT THE END OF THE MOVIE AND SAID THEY LOVED EVERY BIT OF IT. WHY, BECAUSE THEY FELT THEY WERE THE INDIANA JONES IN AN Egypt STORY, A THRILLING JOURNEY OF DISCOVERY ALL THROUGH THIS MOVIE, PLUS FIGHTING UNIQUE VILLAINS, CREATURES, AND GODS, AND THEY LOVED IT MORE THAN THE NEW STAR WARS MOVIE. I love Star Wars, but I grew up with it as a child, while my kids watch too much Star Wars cartoons on cable and seen all the past Star Wars movie. THIS IS AN ULTRA FANTASY MOVIE, SO DIFFERENT FOR MY KIDS EYES THAN TYPICAL STAR TREK, STAR WARS, AND A BUNCH OF OTHERS. MY KIDS GOT TO BECOME VARIOUS DIFFERENT AND THRILLING CHARACTERS ALL THROUGH THIS MOVIE, SO WILL YOURS TOO. I enjoyed this so much more than Clash of the Titans. In this movie, there's hot muscular men for the ladies and drop dead gorgeous model-like ladies for the men. So everybody wins!!! LOL! The only reason it didn't do well is that it should have come out in the summer, NOT after Deadpool, which ROCKS or after Valentine's Day. It's worth the RPX expensive tickets I spent. We had a blast!!! Hope for more positive reviews!!! Definitely, worth watching in the theater, NOT in a few month on your TV. I have a 80" TV and the theater is still fantastic for these types of action pack movies!!!
Its a movie that you can't explain you have to see it for yourself all I have to say is have an open mind and Enjoy it

review_title: Yet Another Great Movie from Our Australian Buddies
review_detailed_main:
Came across this 2016 movie quite by accident from the $5 bin at Walmart...GREAT MOVIE!

For those of you who love this type of Action movie, this is one of the best, from beginning to end with stunning eye-candy effects, action, action, action, excellent story line and ending; and, Geoffrey Rush (Pirates of the Caribbean, et al.) gives a performance very few can miss as him, if they have been following the "Pirates" movies.

Of special note that makes this movie high on my list is the non-use of endless 3rd-grade, street-trash language and constant use of the G-D word, which I guess some movie makers believe this is what makes a movie great (so many B-movies...so little time!).

You can read other reviews if you want to know any further details. But, why spoil it. See the movie.

Musically speaking, this movie is a Very Good Tune!

Good job guys!



.

I'm no longer surprised by the extremely weak note from "the new generation of reviewers" for this movie. Is not a masterpiece, but it deserve at least a 7 note. A film about imagination, a complete fantasy...The story is commercial but fitted together with good actors, what I can't say for the public's favorite "the Force Awakens" And because I am here, " the Force Awakens", a idiot movie, has 8.4 for they, and "The Revenant", a stupid languorously movie, is a "new standard in cinema"..."The Rome" by Federico Fellini has just 7.5...A new era of idiocracy.. I'm glad that i'm too old to catch this new era of stupidity.

review_title: A good fantasy film to watch
review_detailed_main:
I don't think this movie deserves such harsh reviews. I liked the movie and to be honest came to search for part 2 only to find these kind of reviews. And everytime some people think if a movie includes people from all region, no story is required and they agree even when there is implied racism in the name of inclusivity. I couldn't understand anyone these days.

Targeting one particular person or a unit of people with negativity increases day by day with social media. I'm not sure how celebrities or actors who are also human overcome these inhuman activities.lets spread positivity and spread smile..

review_title: Deserves at least a 7 for its boldness.
review_detailed_main:
I enjoyed Gods of Egypt.

Was the CGI bad? Sometimes. Did I care? Not really.

I'm not enough of an expert to say if it does Egyptian mythology entirely right, but I know they got many things right, like Ra dragging the Sun in his chariot, the scales for weighing hearts in the afterlife, Set's murder of Osiris, etc. Things like this it got right, the plot is what deviates from Egyptian mythology.

The usual "woke" social justice warriors whined a lot about the mostly white cast (you'll see some in reviews here) but there are some POC actors in the movie, like Chadwick Boseman as Thoth (best thing in the movie, he was flamboyant & refined R. I. P.) Yaya Deng as Astarte & Elodie Young as Hathor. There were production limitations that prevented Egyptian actors being cast, such as a lack of English speaking Egyptian actors, studio pressure for box office draws that'd been in fantasy blockbusters (Gerard Butler from 300, Coster-Waldau from GoT) & Australian Film Board requirements that most the cast & crew be Aussies. So shut up, it's a fantasy movie about gods, not a documentary.

The production design is awesome. Great creature designs, awesome costumes reminiscent of Stargate, gold gold GOLD everywhere, it's a beautiful unique movie with lots of flair & originality, fantastical set pieces. And a solid cast that sells the story even though they're likely usually on a green-screen set.

I would give it a 7 because sometimes it looks like a videogame & there's some narrative issues. But I'm giving it a 9 to offset all the unfair reviews. It's something you rarely see nowadays, a big budget movie that's daring & takes chances. I'd compare it to another maligned movie I liked that also took a myth & did something daring by upping the fantasy elements, Darren Aranofsky's 'Noah'. Gods of Egypt however is more of a colorful romp than the much darker Noah. Both are larger than life films & worth a viewing.

Gods of Egypt is an action melodrama adventure. Hero Beck (Brenton Thwaites) fights and teams with amazing Egyptian Gods. The ability of Alex Proyas to direct wonderful action scenes is on show. I found the story compelling as the mortal hero, Beck, ran through a myriad of quests to save his love and the world. The CGI was spectacular.

I discovered Gods of Egypt on Netflix, hidden away in the movie list, not featured on the main menu. I can't understand why Netflix doesn't feature this movie because people will be delighted by it. Comic superheroes are for kids, compared to actual gods that ancient civilizations worshiped, who imparted mythological teachings that influenced society and culture.

review_title: While not perfect its still a fun ride while it lasts.
review_detailed_main:
I'm astonished by all the negative reviews here on this film. Those that seem to be analyzing this film inside out seem to have forgotten why we go to the movies in the first place. To have a good time and leave the world behind for a few hours.

That being said this film while not perfect moved along at a steady pace that few films of this type do nowadays, there is hardly a dull moment here as Gerard Butler and Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau battle each other as good and bad gods Set and Horus and take us the audience along with them.

The 3D could have been a bit better all around but some of the set pieces and action scenes made me turn to my movie companion and say that was pretty cool. The look and sound were spot on and the special effects are what you would expect from this type of film.

Ignore the negative reviews get a few friends and escape reality for a couple hours with film. While not perfect its still a fun ride while it lasts. Check it out.

review_title: Its a throwback to Jason and the Argonauts
review_detailed_main: I wasn't expecting anything but special effects and was delightfully surprised that it had a storyline. If you want to see something deep and meaningful, this is not the movie. But if you want to see a mindless romp into fantasy with lavish costumes, fantasy worlds and breathtaking visual effects, this fills the bill. It's very much like Jason and the Argonauts. A lot of the effects were very obviously CGI but it didn't distract from my enjoyment of them. The main characters weren't bad to look at either. I liked the way they handled the violence. It was more like a video game for kids. It could have been really graphic with eyes being ripped out and put back, (still didn't watch that) but I could tell it was more cartoony than gory, which I appreciated. I liked the fact that the gods had gold blood that made the violence more palatable. Which is probably why people aren't liking this movie.

I was shocked to see how many low ratings Gods of Egypt had received. It's really hard in this day and age to find a film where the acting doesn't make you cringe, there's chemistry between the characters, and a plot line scarce of painfully obvious plot-holes. I enjoyed every minute of the movie. Some of these professional critics need to be reminded that this is a hollywood film - not an educational documentary. Changes have been made to make it more engaging for the general public, and as a member of that ordinary demographic, I loved this movie and will be telling everyone I know to give it a watch. (Would've rated it 8/10 except I would like to see the ratings go up to what they deserve.) Give it a chance!!

This one is a decent pop corn movie. I love it and laughed a couples time in the cinema. You can't require a popcorn movie to have any depth or inspire any deep thoughts. A popcorn movie is for people to have fun and enjoy themselves.

I did not get all the white bashing thing. Egyptian are more like people in Middle East than African. Rami Malek is Egyptian descent. Does he look like African? Besides the god of Wisdom is a black actor.

Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau is a great actor. He is fun to watch in this movie. The mistress of the west is great character too. I may re-watch the movie some time later because there are so many details in it.

I thought this is an awesome fantasy film of the year. In fact it's the only film of 2016 I had reviewed so far. Also another reason why I love this mythological references in it as a connoisseur on folklore and myth.

Set in a time in ancient Egypt where the gods live among the humans, vengeful Set killed his brother King Osiris, usurp the throne from his nephew Prince Horus on his coronation and plucked his mystical eyes as well. With that, all of Egypt is enslaved and conquered. Two youngsters Bek and his sweetheart Zaya had managed to steal back one of Horus' eyes. But during their escape, Zaya was shot by an arrow and died. At the tomb where Horus had hid all those years (or months), Bek strikes a bargain with the despondent god: Resurrect Zaya in exchange for the other eye and help to stop Set. That's all I am telling. You folks will have see it for yourself.

Overall, this is an awesome movie. It is very well written and is really cool! The story was perfect, full of suspense and really worth the PG-13 rating. I don't have a favorite scene (I know I had said that many times), because I love the whole film - from beginning to end.

review_title: Way better then the negative reviews it got.
review_detailed_main:
When I saw all the negative review this movie got, I decided to give it a chance anyway. After watching it and expecting it to be horrible, I was surprised to find it was way better then all the people complaining about it claimed.

The story did not follow the Egyptian mythology completely and you could see many changes in the movie. Despite all of that it still made for very good entertainment. This is a movie I can enjoy watching multiple times. I loved the CGI and the way the actors portrayed their characters. I hope they make other movies like this in the future because I will definitely watch.

I have come to the conclusion that I should watch more movies that get negative reviews because it seems more often then not, most of these reviewers get it wrong and the movies turn out way better than they say.

No one should come to this film expecting an accurate representation of ancient Egypt or Egyptian mythology. It's completely not that. In all ways, this is a remarkably well-executed 'dumb' movie, in that it's a simple fantasy action epic that focuses on fun and escapism as its core. The critique of whitewashing would be a good critique of the film if it weren't so obviously a fantasy that has no concern with mimesis. Scottish accents? Fine, I don't care. Does he glower and seem like a bad guy in the classic bad guy sense? Sure does, so it works.

Judging this film to see if it's historically or mythologically accurate is the wrong way to go about it because that's not what the film is trying to do. It's trying to be fun, give you a classic Hollywood fantasy story arc, and give you reasonably good effects and performances and let you just enjoy something for two hours. On that level, it works.

Moreover, what it's really trying to is represent not Egypt as it was, but a version of how Egypt understood itself: not as a country on a globe or continent, but a narrow stripe of the 'world' with the life-giving Nile at core and the endless desert around it. Although this isn't true (the Egyptians clearly know about Greece and other areas), it's somewhat close to the vision they had (just as the Greeks thought they were the center of the world). If you approach the film generous to that idea, then you'll enjoy it as long as you enjoy the spectacle of the thing. If you approach it wanting reality and social justice in casting, you're critiquing via the wrong criteria.

Having heard the tremendous amount of negative reviews I was somewhat hesitant to see the movie. I'm glad to have watched it. It's not likely to win any Oscars, but for once it's not a reboot or a sequel.

This is pure escapism with good CGI, an enjoyable story and some decent acting. True, the story isn't very complicated, but it depicts a hero's journey very well. Two heroes, a sceptical thief and a defeated god. The fact that they made Gods as separate race of beings, easily over 10 feet tall with golden blood was an added bonus to emphasise that despite their human features, they are anything but.

Elodie Young as Hathor was probably one of my favourites. The story resisted the trope portraying her as Egyptian Venus, instead using another one of her roles as the "Mistress of the West", welcoming people into the next life. Another very pleasant surprise was the architect played by Rufus Sewell. A minor role, but performed extremely well.

I do wish they spent more time explaining about the afterlife and the role of Apophis.

All in all, good fun.

review_title: Actually a real good fantasy movie
review_detailed_main: To many reviewers are not letting their inner child getting to enjoy a well casted and well written fantasy action movie. What a shame. I thought this was perfect entertainment and would recommend everyone that likes fantasy movies to watch this. Thumbs up.

review_title: A Feast For The Eyes. The Best God & Sidekick Film Ever?
review_detailed_main: Just viewed this yesterday. An excellent underrated film by Alex Proyas, director of DARK CITY. The film is a visual feast for the eyes, but the acting is top notch as well, this is not a bimboheaded Marvel or Superhero film. Even though the actors are portrayed as being mostly Caucasian, I do not see that as a detraction as there were different dynasties in Egypt and there have even been found mummies portrayed with blue eyes, so no, Egyptian royalty was never exclusively black, those were the Nubians who were south of Egypt. Anyhow, don't let 'HIStory' get in the way of a great entertaining film. One extra star for the depiction of the flat earth (the probable TRUE NATURE of our world).

This movie was exciting, action-packed, adventurous and I loved every second of it... My only mistake was not watching sooner. If you're into Egyptian mythology I highly recommend this film, thanks for creating it

review_title: A tragic failure in promoting a great film
review_detailed_main: The only thing I can figure is that this really epic film is that it was not promoted ahead of its premiere. There could have been some underhanded jealousy in politics that is such an entrenched part of the Hollywood scene. I just can't understand how a film where all the critical elements are steadfastly present, could not be appreciated for its elegant design in all aspects of filmography. This film should have had Oscar written all over it, yet there was no breath of life put into getting the film born appropriately. I'm not going to repeat what all the reviewers who appreciate the movie have said because it's just not necessary. I recommend the film to anyone with an eye for magnificence.

review_title: This is what a movie should be.
review_detailed_main:
Just downright great entertainment from start to finish. Gods of Egypt is a fun fantasy film that takes the idea of the Egyptian gods and comes up with a whole new story that's full of action, adventure, comedy and romance. Truly an epic movie.

I see a lot of complaints about this movie and I honestly can't understand them. People complaining that the story isn't authentic. Well, that is sort of the point. They're not retelling the myths and legends of Egypt, they're taking the characters out of those stories and making something entirely new out of them. Something fun and original, instead of yet another remake of the same trash we've seen copy and pasted into a thousand different films. Originality, especially when it's so wonderfully presented, should NEVER be stifled.

As for those complaining that the movie "looks bad" or has "cheesy CGI", it's clear that they've not been watching the same movie as everyone else. Because this movie is beautiful. The special effects are stunning, the cinematography is beautiful and they just put so much effort into every last detail. I've seen movies with 100 times the budget not look anywhere near this polished.

Gods of Egypt is what we need to see Hollywood do more of. A beautiful, entertaining, and most importantly ORIGINAL concept. Something that's just incredibly fun to watch from start to finish. I would love to see more movies of this quality instead of the carbon copy remakes we keep getting.

review_title: Started off slow, but got better and by the end- it was awesome!
review_detailed_main:
I don't know much about Egypt's ancient myths, so I was a bit concerned that I want be able to understand much of what is going on in the movie. All that I knew about Ancient Egypt and its gods was from a TV animated series called "Adventures of Papyrus". I loved that show as a kid and that's why I decided to give this take on Egyptian mythology a go.

I'm glad I did.

As mention earlier, I was concerned that I want get much of why this guy looks like that or who is this god again? But the movie, being targeted at the general public that has no idea who these guys are, and knowing it, took it's time to introduce as to the workings of that universe and all the characters and did it flawlessly without taking us away from the story.

The things I liked- the visuals and landscapes. Some people here say the cgi sucks. Don't listen to them! It's done right. The acting was superb, especially Gerald Buttler's performance as the movie's baddie. The other actors did not disappoint as well. The story itself was pretty decent, too. Going in to watch a fantasy movie/hero's quest is what I can describe it as.

What I sort of disliked- as I point out in the title- it started off slow. You really need to be patient with this movie. The first half an hour or so, as not as strong as the rest of the movie. I was really doubting if I will like it at all, but I decided to continue watching. Well, it kept getting better and better as time went by.

So to recap, if you like fairy tales, fantasy movies with sword fights, heroes on a quest/journey to fulfill their destiny and these kind of stories- you will enjoy this movie no doubt!

After watching the trailer, I didn't have any good expectations for this movie. I watched it more for a morbid curiosity to see how bad it really was. And I must say, I was thoroughly entertained. The story flows from setting the stakes at the beginning, through many battles and twists it reaches a moving conclusion. And the imaginative way of presenting Egypt's mythology was very refreshing. Watching the trailer I thought they had only used the original mythology as a design guide, but they really use much of the myths accurately or well justified.

Much better than Clash of the Titans, or Percy Jackson in my opinion.

The obvious problem are the visuals, which vary from bad to mediocre, but many scenes were very nice indeed (like the Sphynx, I loved that one).

Overall I would recommend it to any fan of Egyptian Mythology and popcorn movies.

If you love ancient mythology movies you'll love this one. All the characters are super likeable and the casting was great. It doesn't do anything original and follows the basic storyline that most of its genre does, but it does it well.

This was a mostly fun movie. A few bad bits of humor and cringe-worthy acting aside, Gods of Egypt is an action/adventure in the spirit of Immortals and Wrath of the Titans. The battle between Horus and Set is nothing short of spectacular skill and power. The story is simple enough, and serves as a launching pad for the character development and fights. Set was an intimidating and ruthless villain murdering his way across the world to impose his will upon it, and only Horus has the power to stop him. It dragged in parts but the film makes up for it with its exciting and explosive final showdown.

Children will love this movie, and adults can appreciate a film that finally explores Egyptian mythology in a big budget story.

I found this movie to be a feast for the eyes. It was visually very attractive in both the production and the casting. It surprises me that it did not do better in the theaters. I had to watch it several times just to get my fill of the visuals. The story was entertaining, but I would not call it spectacular or worthy of special recognition. But the story does an adequate job of supporting the visuals and their transition from one to the next. The complaints about the ethnicity of the actors was noise in the wind for me. All of the actors were attractive in their roles. This was so much the case I feel obliged to give my compliments to the person responsible for the casting. And while I am doing that allow me to give my compliments to the director. I enjoy watching movies that hold my attention and cause me to marvel at what I am seeing.

I can understand the cries regarding whitewashing but from a purely objective perspective in terms of inventiveness, originality, and premise, I really enjoyed it. As someone who reads folklore and mythology, I appreciated the unique approach to some of the concepts. The forced humor was misplaced but you can see that the film was paying homage to old-school sword and sandals like Hercules and Jason and the Argonauts. I adored 70s and 80s movies of that type.

Elodie Yung shined here and Nikolai was clearly game for the odd role. I was surprised at how Brenton was somewhat wooden in his delivery and came off worst here than his turn in Pirates. My only real complaint was Gerard Butler who can't act and Geoffrey Rush who phoned it in. All in all I enjoyed it more than BvS, MoS and JL COMBINED!

review_title: Spectacular movie! Worth every minute of it.
review_detailed_main: It is a real shame that such greatly portrayed stories are rated so low. This movie is worth every minute of the run, it has all the right components of a great story. Tremendous performances by everyone. Nothing seems to be out of place. Really well done. Watch it when you are really bored and feeling low. Will boost your good emotions and morale. IMDB.com can do better than a 5.4.
Everybody's talking about how unreal it is. Of course it is unreal. I've been out of this realm for 2 hour straight. The over used CGI is complelety fit with this movie, I love it.

review_title: Visually Stunning, on Par with Avatar
review_detailed_main: Saw this movie at an advanced screening and i would definitely have paid to see this movie. The movie in short is about two brothers (gods) who want to be ruler of Egypt and fight each other for power. I didn't give to much away as this is one of those movies you really need to see. There is a lot of cgi and some people may not like that. However i feel that the cgi was so beautifully done like the way avatar was that it transports you to another world, which is what movies are supposed to do. To see this in 3d was just breathtaking. The pyramids and architecture was just so monumental and larger than life. The fight scenes were extremely well done. I think the actors did good for the type of movie it is. it easily looks like they spent 250 mil to make it . I give this movie a 10 and i look forward to it coming on Blu-ray.
These people just point out useless points to criticize such brilliant films...it is a must watch movie...

review_title: Massive production and a great story

review_detailed_main:
CGI is extremely well executed and fight scenes are dynamic and action-packed! Story is good. Obviously it is not exactly the same as ancient Egyptian mythology but it doesn't have to. It's a dmn movie.

Also people complaining aboit characters not being Egyptian, try to get an entire Egyptian cast that speaks English to portray all the people and characters in this movie. Thrust me, you won't.

It's a really well executed movie in the end, even though I might not be politically a 100% correct.

Critics just stop whining about everything for once and enjoy this cinematic piece of art.

review_title: For those of us who still enjoy magic, imagination, & fantasy
review_detailed_main:
I remember growing up loving fantasy films, with their puppet-like animatronic creatures & stop-motion monsters, and primitive 80s era magic effects. Seeing a movie like Gods of Egypt evokes the same feelings of awe and wonder from my childhood, but now with modern Hollywood quality CGI, looking better than anything from the fantasy films I watched as a kid.

This is a visually impressive, imaginative, fun fantasy adventure with likable characters, in a classic story of good vs evil, in a unique setting, a fantastic version of ancient Egypt that's like nothing ever seen in real Earth history. What's not to like?

Highlights: - An action scene with two gigantic fire-breathing snakes. This is why we watch action fantasy, for cool scenes like this.

What "aubuchon" said...but to add to it: I also had reservations and only watched because I'm a huge Game of Thrones fan and figured if Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau was in it, then chances were, it would be good.
